oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Bill Wilkerson Hearing and Speech Center building, Nashville, Tennessee, n.d.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: An exterior view of the Bill Wilkerson Hearing and Speech Center building in Nashville, Tennessee, located on 19th Avenue. This is the first facility that was constructed circa 1956. It was named for the son of the founder, Dr. Wesley Wilkerson. The young soldier Bill Wilkerson (1925-1945) was killed in the Battle of the Bulge at the age of 19. During the next few decades, a modern facility was built at Vanderbilt University’s Medical Center East and the scope of its program mission expanded. Forms part of Record Group 3, Metro Davidson County Photographer. 1 35 mm slide, filmstrip : b & w.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Bill Wilkerson Hearing and Speech Center
